t: Luke 7
Now*p when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
And*p a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.
And*p when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.
And*p when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:
For*p he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

Then*p Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:
Wherefore*p neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.
For*p I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

When*p Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r so*r great*r faith,*r no,*r not*r in*r Israel.*r
And*p they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.
And*p it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.
Now*p when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
And*p when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep*r not.*r
And*p he came and touched the bier: and they that bare him stood still. And he said, Young*r man,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r Arise.*r
And*p he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
And*p there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
And*p this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
And*p the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.
And*p John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
When*p the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
And*p in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many that were blind he gave sight.

Then*p Jesus answering said unto them, Go*r your*r way,*r and*r tell*r John*r what*r things*r ye*r have*r seen*r and*r heard;*r how*r that*r the*r blind*r see,*r the*r lame*r walk,*r the*r lepers*r are*r cleansed,*r the*r deaf*r hear,*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r to*r the*r poor*r the*r gospel*r is*r preached.*r
And*rp blessed*r is*r he,*r whosoever*r shall*r not*r be*r offended*r in*r me.*r

And*p when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What*r went*r ye*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r for*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r with*r the*r wind?*r

But*rp what*r went*r ye*r out*r for*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r clothed*r in*r soft*r raiment?*r Behold,*r they*r which*r are*r gorgeously*r apparelled,*r and*r live*r delicately,*r are*r in*r kings'*r courts.*r
But*rp what*r went*r ye*r out*r for*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yea,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r and*r much*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*rp is*r he,*r of*r whom*r it*r is*r written,*r Behold,*r I*r send*r my*r messenger*r before*r thy*r face,*r which*r shall*r prepare*r thy*r way*r before*r thee.*r

For*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Among*r those*r that*r are*r born*r of*r women*r there*r is*r not*r a*r greater*r prophet*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist:*r but*r he*r that*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
And*p all the people that heard him, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
But*p the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.
And*p the Lord said, Whereunto*r then*r shall*r I*r liken*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation?*r and*r to*r what*r are*r they*r like?*r

They*rp are*r like*r unto*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplace,*r and*r calling*r one*r to*r another,*r and*r saying,*r We*r have*r piped*r unto*r you,*r and*r ye*r have*r not*r danced;*r we*r have*r mourned*r to*r you,*r and*r ye*r have*r not*r wept.*r
For*rp John*r the*r Baptist*r came*r neither*r eating*r bread*r nor*r drinking*r wine;*r and*r ye*r say,*r He*r hath*r a*r devil.*r
The*rp Son*r of*r man*r is*r come*r eating*r and*r drinking;*r and*r ye*r say,*r Behold*r a*r gluttonous*r man,*r and*r a*r winebibber,*r a*r friend*r of*r publicans*r and*r sinners!*r
But*rp wisdom*r is*r justified*r of*r all*r her*r children.*r
And*p one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.
And,*p behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee's house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,
And*p stood at his feet behind him weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

Now*p when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.
And*p Jesus answering said unto him, Simon,*r I*r have*r somewhat*r to*r say*r unto*r thee.*r And he saith, Master, say on.
There*rp was*r a*r certain*r creditor*r which*r had*r two*r debtors:*r the*r one*r owed*r five*r hundred*r pence,*r and*r the*r other*r fifty.*r
And*rp when*r they*r had*r nothing*r to*r pay,*r he*r frankly*r forgave*r them*r both.*r Tell*r me*r therefore,*r which*r of*r them*r will*r love*r him*r most?*r
Simon*p answered and said, I suppose that he, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou*r hast*r rightly*r judged.*r

And*p he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest*r thou*r this*r woman?*r I*r entered*r into*r thine*r house,*r thou*r gavest*r me*r no*r water*r for*r my*r feet:*r but*r she*r hath*r washed*r my*r feet*r with*r tears,*r and*r wiped*r them*r with*r the*r hairs*r of*r her*r head.*r
Thou*rp gavest*r me*r no*r kiss:*r but*r this*r woman*r since*r the*r time*r I*r came*r in*r hath*r not*r ceased*r to*r kiss*r my*r feet.*r
My*rp head*r with*r oil*r thou*r didst*r not*r anoint:*r but*r this*r woman*r hath*r anointed*r my*r feet*r with*r ointment.*r
Wherefore*rp I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r Her*r sins,*r which*r are*r many,*r are*r forgiven;*r for*r she*r loved*r much:*r but*r to*r whom*r little*r is*r forgiven,*r the*r same*r loveth*r little.*r
And*p he said unto her, Thy*r sins*r are*r forgiven.*r
And*p they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?
And*p he said to the woman, Thy*r faith*r hath*r saved*r thee;*r go*r in*r peace.*r
